newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia said exposed to possible tsunami disaster.
newsitem.headline: Australia said exposed to possible tsunami disaster.

text.p: There is a 15 percent chance Australia will be hit by a giant tsunami, or harbour wave, in a 100-year period, scientists were told on Wednesday.
"This is something that the infrastructure builders should be considering," Ted Bryant of Australia's Woolongong University said at a conference on global weather.
In the last 1,000 years, Australia's coastline has been hit by a number of tsunamis, some followed by waves more than 80 metres high, Bryant said.
One tsunami that hit eastern Australia about 300 years ago may have been caused by an asteroid, Bryant said.
